title: Nicola Sturgeon sends pound PLUNGING as fears over second referendum grow
text:
Bloomberg The pound has tumbled against the euro over Scottish referendum fears 
If Mrs Sturgeon gets her way, a fresh Scottish vote would reportedly be held next year - during the peak of Brexit negotiations. Experts said the pound could also be troubled by the prospect of Mrs May clashing with Brussels over freedom of movement to Britain. Michael Hewson, chief market analyst at CMC Markets UK, said: "The pound has come under pressure in Asia early on with some reports suggesting that the Scottish government could look to call another independence referendum sometime next year." Related articles Gold prices surge amid fears   about to CRASH 
He added: "Though the weakness may well have also been prompted by other reports that UK Prime Minister Theresa May could well introduce curbs on freedom of movement at the same time as she comes to trigger Article 50 at the end of March."It is reported that any EU national who arrives here after that date would not automatically have the right to stay in the UK permanently. "This may set the stage for early disagreements with EU leaders before talks even get under way."
